summary: The Stop Government Abandonment and Placement Scandals Act of 2025 (Stop GAPS Act) addresses the handling of unaccompanied alien children (UACs). The bill mandates that the Secretary of Homeland Security amends existing regulations. It also requires the Director of the Office of Refugee Resettlement to track released UACs involved in immigration proceedings within the U.S. and to collaborate with states to secure placements for these children.
